bug.author: mmuppidi
bug.summary: Is build version displayed by Kubeflow on dashboard correct ?
bug.description:
I just upgraded my Kubeflow to v0.6.1-rc.1, but the dashboard still displays build version 0.5.0. Is there a bug here or did my upgrade not work ? Here is the command I used to upgrade <denchmark-code>${KUBEFLOW_SRC}/scripts/upgrade_kfp.sh 85284312a5c472ccbf9700de4e3ede99b9eb8b51 </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8787305/61979773-caa77880-afc2-11e9-82dc-e4e54ab3297a.png></denchmark-link>

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label kind/bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.57. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/kubeflow/kubeflow>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.

Answering because I just happen to know this. Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/mmuppidi>@mmuppidi</denchmark-link> , as stated by the script's name (kfp for kubeflow pipelines), it upgrades only kubeflow pipeline. It doesn't upgrade kubeflow to 0.6. You can find related doc in: <denchmark-link:https://v0-5.kubeflow.org/docs/pipelines/upgrade/>https://v0-5.kubeflow.org/docs/pipelines/upgrade/</denchmark-link>
Upgrade instructions are outdated (no longer work), depending on your needs, you can follow "reinstall kubeflow pipelines" instructions <denchmark-link:https://master.kubeflow.org/docs/pipelines/upgrade/>https://master.kubeflow.org/docs/pipelines/upgrade/</denchmark-link> to keep existing pipeline data.

The rc that you deployed from didn't have updated Central Dashboard and hence the wrong version. That said there is a bug in the version identification and I have filed <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/issues/3875>#3875</denchmark-link> for that.
